50  /**
51   * A component that holds all data paths for a single node.
52   */
53  public class NodeEnvironment extends AbstractComponent implements Closeable{
54  
55      /* ${data.paths}/nodes/{node.id} */
56      private final Path[] nodePaths;
57      /* ${data.paths}/nodes/{node.id}/indices */
58      private final Path[] nodeIndicesPaths;
59      private final Lock[] locks;
60      private final boolean addNodeId;
61  
62      private final int localNodeId;
63      private final AtomicBoolean closed = new AtomicBoolean(false);
64      private final Map<ShardId, InternalShardLock> shardLocks = new HashMap<>();
65  
66      private final boolean customPathsEnabled;
67  
68      // Setting to automatically append node id to custom data paths
69      public static final String ADD_NODE_ID_TO_CUSTOM_PATH = "node.add_id_to_custom_path";
70      // Setting to enable custom index.data_path setting for new indices
71      public static final String SETTING_CUSTOM_DATA_PATH_ENABLED = "node.enable_custom_paths";
72  
73      public static final String NODES_FOLDER = "nodes";
74      public static final String INDICES_FOLDER = "indices";
75      public static final String NODE_LOCK_FILENAME = "node.lock";
76  
77      @Inject
78      public NodeEnvironment(Settings settings, Environment environment) throws IOException {
79          super(settings);
80  
81          this.addNodeId = settings.getAsBoolean(ADD_NODE_ID_TO_CUSTOM_PATH, true);
82          this.customPathsEnabled = settings.getAsBoolean(SETTING_CUSTOM_DATA_PATH_ENABLED, false);
83  
84          if (!DiscoveryNode.nodeRequiresLocalStorage(settings)) {
85              nodePaths = null;
86              nodeIndicesPaths = null;
87              locks = null;
88              localNodeId = -1;
89              return;
90          }
91  
92          final Path[] nodePaths = new Path[environment.dataWithClusterFiles().length];
93          final Lock[] locks = new Lock[environment.dataWithClusterFiles().length];
94          int localNodeId = -1;
95          IOException lastException = null;
96          int maxLocalStorageNodes = settings.getAsInt("node.max_local_storage_nodes", 50);
97          for (int possibleLockId = 0; possibleLockId < maxLocalStorageNodes; possibleLockId++) {
98              for (int dirIndex = 0; dirIndex < environment.dataWithClusterFiles().length; dirIndex++) {
99                  Path dir = environment.dataWithClusterFiles()[dirIndex].resolve(Paths.get(NODES_FOLDER, Integer.toString(possibleLockId)));
100                 Files.createDirectories(dir);
101                 
102                 try (Directory luceneDir = FSDirectory.open(dir, NativeFSLockFactory.INSTANCE)) {
103                     logger.trace("obtaining node lock on {} ...", dir.toAbsolutePath());
104                     Lock tmpLock = luceneDir.makeLock(NODE_LOCK_FILENAME);
105                     boolean obtained = tmpLock.obtain();
106                     if (obtained) {
107                         locks[dirIndex] = tmpLock;
108                         nodePaths[dirIndex] = dir;
109                         localNodeId = possibleLockId;
110                     } else {
111                         logger.trace("failed to obtain node lock on {}", dir.toAbsolutePath());
112                         // release all the ones that were obtained up until now
113                         for (int i = 0; i < locks.length; i++) {
114                             if (locks[i] != null) {
115                                 IOUtils.closeWhileHandlingException(locks[i]);
116                             }
117                             locks[i] = null;
118                         }
119                         break;
120                     }
121                 } catch (IOException e) {
122                     logger.trace("failed to obtain node lock on {}", e, dir.toAbsolutePath());
123                     lastException = new IOException("failed to obtain lock on " + dir.toAbsolutePath(), e);
124                     // release all the ones that were obtained up until now
125                     for (int i = 0; i < locks.length; i++) {
126                         IOUtils.closeWhileHandlingException(locks[i]);
127                         locks[i] = null;
128                     }
129                     break;
130                 }
131             }
132             if (locks[0] != null) {
133                 // we found a lock, break
134                 break;
135             }
136         }
137         if (locks[0] == null) {
138             throw new ElasticsearchIllegalStateException("Failed to obtain node lock, is the following location writable?: "
139                     + Arrays.toString(environment.dataWithClusterFiles()), lastException);
140         }
141 
142         this.localNodeId = localNodeId;
143         this.locks = locks;
144         this.nodePaths = nodePaths;
145 
146 
147         if (logger.isDebugEnabled()) {
148             logger.debug("using node location [{}], local_node_id [{}]", nodePaths, localNodeId);
149         }
150         if (logger.isTraceEnabled()) {
151             StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("node data locations details:\n");
152             for (Path file : nodePaths) {
153                 sb.append(" -> ")
154                         .append(file.toAbsolutePath())
155                         .append(", free_space [")
156                         .append(new ByteSizeValue(Files.getFileStore(file).getUnallocatedSpace()))
157                         .append("], usable_space [")
158                         .append(new ByteSizeValue(Files.getFileStore(file).getUsableSpace()))
159                         .append("]\n");
160             }
161             logger.trace(sb.toString());
162         }
163 
164         this.nodeIndicesPaths = new Path[nodePaths.length];
165         for (int i = 0; i < nodePaths.length; i++) {
166             nodeIndicesPaths[i] = nodePaths[i].resolve(INDICES_FOLDER);
167         }
168     }

172     /**
173      * Deletes a shard data directory iff the shards locks were successfully acquired.
174      *
175      * @param shardId the id of the shard to delete to delete
176      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs
177      */
178     public void deleteShardDirectorySafe(ShardId shardId, @IndexSettings Settings indexSettings) throws IOException {
179         // This is to ensure someone doesn't use ImmutableSettings.EMPTY
180         assert indexSettings != ImmutableSettings.EMPTY;
181         final Path[] paths = shardPaths(shardId);
182         logger.trace("deleting shard {} directory, paths: [{}]", shardId, paths);
183         try (ShardLock lock = shardLock(shardId)) {
184             deleteShardDirectoryUnderLock(lock, indexSettings);
185         }
186     }
187 
188     /**
189      * Deletes a shard data directory. Note: this method assumes that the shard lock is acquired
190      *
191      * @param lock the shards lock
192      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs
193      */
194     public void deleteShardDirectoryUnderLock(ShardLock lock, @IndexSettings Settings indexSettings) throws IOException {
195         assert indexSettings != ImmutableSettings.EMPTY;
196         final ShardId shardId = lock.getShardId();
197         assert isShardLocked(shardId) : "shard " + shardId + " is not locked";
198         final Path[] paths = shardPaths(shardId);
199         IOUtils.rm(paths);
200         if (hasCustomDataPath(indexSettings)) {
201             Path customLocation = resolveCustomLocation(indexSettings, shardId);
202             logger.trace("deleting custom shard {} directory [{}]", shardId, customLocation);
203             IOUtils.rm(customLocation);
204         }
205         logger.trace("deleted shard {} directory, paths: [{}]", shardId, paths);
206         assert FileSystemUtils.exists(paths) == false;
207     }
208 
209     private boolean isShardLocked(ShardId id) {
210         try {
211             shardLock(id, 0).close();
212             return false;
213         } catch (IOException ex) {
214             return true;
215         }
216     }
217 
218     /**
219      * Deletes an indexes data directory recursively iff all of the indexes
220      * shards locks were successfully acquired. If any of the indexes shard directories can't be locked
221      * non of the shards will be deleted
222      *
223      * @param index the index to delete
224      * @param lockTimeoutMS how long to wait for acquiring the indices shard locks
225      * @param indexSettings settings for the index being deleted
226      * @throws Exception if any of the shards data directories can't be locked or deleted
227      */
228     public void deleteIndexDirectorySafe(Index index, long lockTimeoutMS, @IndexSettings Settings indexSettings) throws IOException {
229         // This is to ensure someone doesn't use ImmutableSettings.EMPTY
230         assert indexSettings != ImmutableSettings.EMPTY;
231         final List<ShardLock> locks = lockAllForIndex(index, indexSettings, lockTimeoutMS);
232         try {
233             deleteIndexDirectoryUnderLock(index, indexSettings);
234         } finally {
235             IOUtils.closeWhileHandlingException(locks);
236         }
237     }
238 
239     /**
240      * Deletes an indexes data directory recursively.
241      * Note: this method assumes that the shard lock is acquired
242      *
243      * @param index the index to delete
244      * @param indexSettings settings for the index being deleted
245      */
246     public void deleteIndexDirectoryUnderLock(Index index, @IndexSettings Settings indexSettings) throws IOException {
247         // This is to ensure someone doesn't use ImmutableSettings.EMPTY
248         assert indexSettings != ImmutableSettings.EMPTY;
249         final Path[] indexPaths = indexPaths(index);
250         logger.trace("deleting index {} directory, paths({}): [{}]", index, indexPaths.length, indexPaths);
251         IOUtils.rm(indexPaths);
252         if (hasCustomDataPath(indexSettings)) {
253             Path customLocation = resolveCustomLocation(indexSettings, index.name());
254             logger.trace("deleting custom index {} directory [{}]", index, customLocation);
255             IOUtils.rm(customLocation);
256         }
257     }

260     /**
261      * Tries to lock all local shards for the given index. If any of the shard locks can't be acquired
262      * an {@link LockObtainFailedException} is thrown and all previously acquired locks are released.
263      *
264      * @param index the index to lock shards for
265      * @param lockTimeoutMS how long to wait for acquiring the indices shard locks
266      * @return the {@link ShardLock} instances for this index.
267      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs.
268      */
269     public List<ShardLock> lockAllForIndex(Index index, @IndexSettings Settings settings, long lockTimeoutMS) throws IOException {
270         final Integer numShards = settings.getAsInt(IndexMetaData.SETTING_NUMBER_OF_SHARDS, null);
271         if (numShards == null || numShards <= 0) {
272             throw new IllegalArgumentException("settings must contain a non-null > 0 number of shards");
273         }
274         logger.trace("locking all shards for index {} - [{}]", index, numShards);
275         List<ShardLock> allLocks = new ArrayList<>(numShards);
276         boolean success = false;
277         long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
278         try {
279             for (int i = 0; i < numShards; i++) {
280                 long timeoutLeft = Math.max(0, lockTimeoutMS - (System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime));
281                 allLocks.add(shardLock(new ShardId(index, i), timeoutLeft));
282             }
283             success = true;
284         } finally {
285             if (success == false) {
286                 logger.trace("unable to lock all shards for index {}", index);
287                 IOUtils.closeWhileHandlingException(allLocks);
288             }
289         }
290         return allLocks;
291     }
292 
293     /**
294      * Tries to lock the given shards ID. A shard lock is required to perform any kind of
295      * write operation on a shards data directory like deleting files, creating a new index writer
296      * or recover from a different shard instance into it. If the shard lock can not be acquired
297      * an {@link LockObtainFailedException} is thrown.
298      *
299      * Note: this method will return immediately if the lock can't be acquired.
300      *
301      * @param id the shard ID to lock
302      * @return the shard lock. Call {@link ShardLock#close()} to release the lock
303      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs.
304      */
305     public ShardLock shardLock(ShardId id) throws IOException {
306         return shardLock(id, 0);
307     }
308 
309     /**
310      * Tries to lock the given shards ID. A shard lock is required to perform any kind of
311      * write operation on a shards data directory like deleting files, creating a new index writer
312      * or recover from a different shard instance into it. If the shard lock can not be acquired
313      * an {@link org.apache.lucene.store.LockObtainFailedException} is thrown
314      * @param id the shard ID to lock
315      * @param lockTimeoutMS the lock timeout in milliseconds
316      * @return the shard lock. Call {@link ShardLock#close()} to release the lock
317      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs.
318      */
319     public ShardLock shardLock(final ShardId id, long lockTimeoutMS) throws IOException {
320         logger.trace("acquiring node shardlock on [{}], timeout [{}]", id, lockTimeoutMS);
321         final InternalShardLock shardLock;
322         final boolean acquired;
323         synchronized (shardLocks) {
324             if (shardLocks.containsKey(id)) {
325                 shardLock = shardLocks.get(id);
326                 shardLock.incWaitCount();
327                 acquired = false;
328             } else {
329                 shardLock = new InternalShardLock(id);
330                 shardLocks.put(id, shardLock);
331                 acquired = true;
332             }
333         }
334         if (acquired == false) {
335             boolean success = false;
336             try {
337                 shardLock.acquire(lockTimeoutMS);
338                 success = true;
339             } finally {
340                 if (success == false) {
341                     shardLock.decWaitCount();
342                 }
343             }
344         }
345         logger.trace("successfully acquired shardlock for [{}]", id);
346         return new ShardLock(id) { // new instance prevents double closing
347             @Override
348             protected void closeInternal() {
349                 shardLock.release();
350                 logger.trace("released shard lock for [{}]", id);
351             }
352         };
353     }
354 
355     /**
356      * Returns all currently lock shards
357      */
358     public Set<ShardId> lockedShards() {
359         synchronized (shardLocks) {
360             ImmutableSet.Builder<ShardId> builder = ImmutableSet.builder();
361             return builder.addAll(shardLocks.keySet()).build();
362         }
363     }
364 
365     private final class InternalShardLock {
366         /*
367          * This class holds a mutex for exclusive access and timeout / wait semantics
368          * and a reference count to cleanup the shard lock instance form the internal data
369          * structure if nobody is waiting for it. the wait count is guarded by the same lock
370          * that is used to mutate the map holding the shard locks to ensure exclusive access
371          */
372         private final Semaphore mutex = new Semaphore(1);
373         private int waitCount = 1; // guarded by shardLocks
374         private ShardId shardId;
375 
376         InternalShardLock(ShardId id) {
377             shardId = id;
378             mutex.acquireUninterruptibly();
379         }
380 
381         protected void release() {
382             mutex.release();
383             decWaitCount();
384         }
385 
386         void incWaitCount() {
387             synchronized (shardLocks) {
388                 assert waitCount > 0 : "waitCount is " + waitCount + " but should be > 0";
389                 waitCount++;
390             }
391         }
392 
393         private void decWaitCount() {
394             synchronized (shardLocks) {
395                 assert waitCount > 0 : "waitCount is " + waitCount + " but should be > 0";
396                 --waitCount;
397                 logger.trace("shard lock wait count for [{}] is now [{}]", shardId, waitCount);
398                 if (waitCount == 0) {
399                     logger.trace("last shard lock wait decremented, removing lock for [{}]", shardId);
400                     InternalShardLock remove = shardLocks.remove(shardId);
401                     assert remove != null : "Removed lock was null";
402                 }
403             }
404         }
405 
406         void acquire(long timeoutInMillis) throws LockObtainFailedException{
407             try {
408                 if (mutex.tryAcquire(timeoutInMillis, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS) == false) {
409                     throw new LockObtainFailedException("Can't lock shard " + shardId + ", timed out after " + timeoutInMillis + "ms");
410                 }
411             } catch (InterruptedException e) {
412                 Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
413                 throw new LockObtainFailedException("Can't lock shard " + shardId + ", interrupted", e);
414             }
415         }
416     }

422     public boolean hasNodeFile() {
423         return nodePaths != null && locks != null;

426     /**
427      * Returns an array of all of the nodes data locations.
428      * @throws org.elasticsearch.ElasticsearchIllegalStateException if the node is not configured to store local locations
429      */
430     public Path[] nodeDataPaths() {
431         assert assertEnvIsLocked();
432         if (nodePaths == null || locks == null) {
433             throw new ElasticsearchIllegalStateException("node is not configured to store local location");
434         }
435         return nodePaths;
436     }

438     /**
439      * Returns all data paths excluding custom index paths.
440      */
441     public Path[] indexPaths(Index index) {
442         assert assertEnvIsLocked();
443         Path[] indexPaths = new Path[nodeIndicesPaths.length];
444         for (int i = 0; i < nodeIndicesPaths.length; i++) {
445             indexPaths[i] = nodeIndicesPaths[i].resolve(index.name());
446         }
447         return indexPaths;
448     }
449 
450     /**
451      * Returns all paths where lucene data will be stored, if a index.data_path
452      * setting is present, will return the custom data path to be used
453      */
454     public Path[] shardDataPaths(ShardId shardId, @IndexSettings Settings indexSettings) {
455         assert indexSettings != ImmutableSettings.EMPTY;
456         assert assertEnvIsLocked();
457         if (hasCustomDataPath(indexSettings)) {
458             return new Path[] {resolveCustomLocation(indexSettings, shardId)};
459         } else {
460             return shardPaths(shardId);
461         }
462     }
463 
464     /**
465      * Returns all shard paths excluding custom shard path
466      */
467     public Path[] shardPaths(ShardId shardId) {
468         assert assertEnvIsLocked();
469         final Path[] nodePaths = nodeDataPaths();
470         final Path[] shardLocations = new Path[nodePaths.length];
471         for (int i = 0; i < nodePaths.length; i++) {
472             shardLocations[i] = nodePaths[i].resolve(Paths.get(INDICES_FOLDER,
473                     shardId.index().name(),
474                     Integer.toString(shardId.id())));
475         }
476         return shardLocations;
477     }
478 
479     public Set<String> findAllIndices() throws Exception {
480         if (nodePaths == null || locks == null) {
481             throw new ElasticsearchIllegalStateException("node is not configured to store local location");
482         }
483         assert assertEnvIsLocked();
484         Set<String> indices = Sets.newHashSet();
485         for (Path indicesLocation : nodeIndicesPaths) {
486 
487             if (Files.isDirectory(indicesLocation)) {
488                 try (DirectoryStream<Path> stream = Files.newDirectoryStream(indicesLocation)) {
489                     for (Path index : stream) {
490                         if (Files.isDirectory(index)) {
491                             indices.add(index.getFileName().toString());
492                         }
493                     }
494                 }
495             }
496         }
497         return indices;
498     }
499 
500     /**
501      * Tries to find all allocated shards for the given index or for all indices iff the given index is {@code null}
502      * on the current node. NOTE: This methods is prone to race-conditions on the filesystem layer since it might not
503      * see directories created concurrently or while it's traversing.
504      * @param index the index to filter shards for or {@code null} if all shards for all indices should be listed
505      * @return a set of shard IDs
506      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs
507      */
508     public Set<ShardId> findAllShardIds(final Index index) throws IOException {
509         if (nodePaths == null || locks == null) {
510             throw new ElasticsearchIllegalStateException("node is not configured to store local location");
511         }
512         assert assertEnvIsLocked();
513         return findAllShardIds(index == null ? null : index.getName(), nodeIndicesPaths);
514     }
515 
516     private static Set<ShardId> findAllShardIds(@Nullable final String index, Path... locations) throws IOException {
517         final Set<ShardId> shardIds = Sets.newHashSet();
518         for (final Path location : locations) {
519             if (Files.isDirectory(location)) {
520                 try (DirectoryStream<Path> indexStream = Files.newDirectoryStream(location)) {
521                     for (Path indexPath : indexStream) {
522                         if (index == null || index.equals(indexPath.getFileName().toString())) {
523                             shardIds.addAll(findAllShardsForIndex(indexPath));
524                         }
525                     }
526                 }
527             }
528         }
529         return shardIds;
530     }
531 
532     private static Set<ShardId> findAllShardsForIndex(Path indexPath) throws IOException {
533         Set<ShardId> shardIds = new HashSet<>();
534         if (Files.isDirectory(indexPath)) {
535             try (DirectoryStream<Path> stream = Files.newDirectoryStream(indexPath)) {
536                 String currentIndex = indexPath.getFileName().toString();
537                 for (Path shardPath : stream) {
538                     if (Files.isDirectory(shardPath)) {
539                         Integer shardId = Ints.tryParse(shardPath.getFileName().toString());
540                         if (shardId != null) {
541                             ShardId id = new ShardId(currentIndex, shardId);
542                             shardIds.add(id);
543                         }
544                     }
545                 }
546             }
547         }
548         return shardIds;
549     }
550 
551     /**
552      * Tries to find all allocated shards for all indices iff the given index on the current node. NOTE: This methods
553      * is prone to race-conditions on the filesystem layer since it might not see directories created concurrently or
554      * while it's traversing.
555      *
556      * @return a set of shard IDs
557      * @throws IOException if an IOException occurs
558      */
559     public Set<ShardId> findAllShardIds() throws IOException {
560         return findAllShardIds(null);
561     }
562 
563     @Override
564     public void close() {
565         if (closed.compareAndSet(false, true) && locks != null) {
566             for (Lock lock : locks) {
567                 try {
568                     logger.trace("releasing lock [{}]", lock);
569                     lock.close();
570                 } catch (IOException e) {
571                     logger.trace("failed to release lock [{}]", e, lock);
572                 }
573             }
574         }
575     }
576 
577 
578     private boolean assertEnvIsLocked() {
579         if (!closed.get() && locks != null) {
580             for (Lock lock : locks) {
581                 try {
582                     assert lock.isLocked() : "Lock: " + lock + "is not locked";
583                 } catch (IOException e) {
584                     logger.warn("lock assertion failed", e);
585                     return false;
586                 }
587             }
588         }
589         return true;
590     }
591 
592     /**
593      * This method tries to write an empty file and moves it using an atomic move operation.
594      * This method throws an {@link ElasticsearchIllegalStateException} if this operation is
595      * not supported by the filesystem. This test is executed on each of the data directories.
596      * This method cleans up all files even in the case of an error.
597      */
598     public void ensureAtomicMoveSupported() throws IOException {
599         final Path[] nodePaths = nodeDataPaths();
600         for (Path directory : nodePaths) {
601             assert Files.isDirectory(directory) : directory + " is not a directory";
602             final Path src = directory.resolve("__es__.tmp");
603             Files.createFile(src);
604             final Path target = directory.resolve("__es__.final");
605             try {
606                 Files.move(src, target, StandardCopyOption.ATOMIC_MOVE);
607             } catch (AtomicMoveNotSupportedException ex) {
608                 throw new ElasticsearchIllegalStateException("atomic_move is not supported by the filesystem on path ["
609                         + directory
610                         + "] atomic_move is required for elasticsearch to work correctly.", ex);
611             } finally {
612                 Files.deleteIfExists(src);
613                 Files.deleteIfExists(target);
614             }
615         }
616     }

635     /**
636      * Resolve the custom path for a index's shard.
637      * Uses the {@code IndexMetaData.SETTING_DATA_PATH} setting to determine
638      * the root path for the index.
639      *
640      * @param indexSettings settings for the index
641      */
642     private Path resolveCustomLocation(@IndexSettings Settings indexSettings) {
643         assert indexSettings != ImmutableSettings.EMPTY;
644         String customDataDir = indexSettings.get(IndexMetaData.SETTING_DATA_PATH);
645         if (customDataDir != null) {
646             // This assert is because this should be caught by MetaDataCreateIndexService
647             assert customPathsEnabled;
648             if (addNodeId) {
649                 return Paths.get(customDataDir, Integer.toString(this.localNodeId));
650             } else {
651                 return Paths.get(customDataDir);
652             }
653         } else {
654             throw new ElasticsearchIllegalArgumentException("no custom " + IndexMetaData.SETTING_DATA_PATH + " setting available");
655         }
656     }
657 
658     /**
659      * Resolve the custom path for a index's shard.
660      * Uses the {@code IndexMetaData.SETTING_DATA_PATH} setting to determine
661      * the root path for the index.
662      *
663      * @param indexSettings settings for the index
664      * @param indexName index to resolve the path for
665      */
666     private Path resolveCustomLocation(@IndexSettings Settings indexSettings, final String indexName) {
667         return resolveCustomLocation(indexSettings).resolve(indexName);
668     }
669 
670     /**
671      * Resolve the custom path for a index's shard.
672      * Uses the {@code IndexMetaData.SETTING_DATA_PATH} setting to determine
673      * the root path for the index.
674      *
675      * @param indexSettings settings for the index
676      * @param shardId shard to resolve the path to
677      */
678     public Path resolveCustomLocation(@IndexSettings Settings indexSettings, final ShardId shardId) {
679         return resolveCustomLocation(indexSettings, shardId.index().name()).resolve(Integer.toString(shardId.id()));
680     }
